instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: 01700 (LR350)
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_T</SIGNAL> 0v 0.337
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.59v 0.394
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> 0v 0.269
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> 0v 0.272
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> 0v 0.380
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> 3.38v 0.365

Cleaned corrosion around J4802 and <TRANSISTOR>Q5100</TRANSISTOR> before readings taken.
No corrosion found elsewhere.

threads.title: 01700 (LR350)
threads.message:
Is the machine detected in DFU mode?
If not, check all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages; small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

threads.title: 01700 (LR350)
threads.message: I put it back together and it works fine. The touchbar cable had a small amount of corrosion and the screen sleep sensor was badly corroded. I cleaned both. The touchbar works fine, but the sleep sensor cable is damaged.
